args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Heine-Borel theorem for finite-dimensional real normed spaces:
If E is a finite-dimensional normed space over ℝ, then every closed and bounded
subset S of E is compact. -/
variable {E : Type _} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ℝ E] [FiniteDimensional ℝ E]

theorem heine_borel_closed_bounded_compact {S : Set E} (hclosed : IsClosed S) (hbounded : IsBounded S) : IsCompact S := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Heine-Borel theorem for the real line: closed and bounded subsets of ℝ are compact. -/
theorem heine_borel_R {S : Set ℝ} (hclosed : IsClosed S) (hbounded : Bounded S) : IsCompact S := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- In a proper metric space, every closed and bounded subset is compact. -/
variable {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X] [ProperSpace X]

theorem closed_bounded_compact {S : Set X} (hclosed : IsClosed S) (hbounded : Bounded S) : IsCompact S := by sorry
